metadata.title: Tuesday, 30th October, 2012
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)    when a district information officer will be posted to Mulobezi District; and
(b)    when transport will be provided to the District Office.

questions.minister: Minister of Foreign Affairs what measures the Government has taken to resolve the boundary wrangle which has persisted for over 30 years in the Mpweto-Kaputa areas between the Republic of Zambia and the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the Government will complete constructing the Mayukwayukwa Secondary School in Mangango Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)    what the total cost of constructing the school is;
(c)    when the school will be opened to the public; and
(d)    whether the school will cater for both boys and girls.
(a)    how many doctors, clinical officers and nurses were in Mulobezi District as of June, 2012; and
(b)    when more medical personnel will be posted to health institutions in Mulobezi especially Sichili Mission Hospital which has been without a doctor for sometime now.
(a)    how many members of the Zambian delegation attended the China-Africa Cooperation meeting in Beijing in 2011; and
(b)    how much money was spent on the trip for the entire delegation.
(a)    what trophies are competed for annually by football clubs under the Football Association of Zambia; and
(b)    of the trophies at (a) above, which ones are competed for under the following categories:
(i)    Division Two; (ii)   Division One; and (iii)  Premier Division.
(a)    when the Government will construct a magistrate court building in Gwembe; and
(b)    when local court buildings in Gwembe District will be rehabilitated.
(a)    what the wage bill for the Zambia Revenue Authority (ZRA) was, country-wide as of June, 2012 for the following categories:
(i)    senior management; (ii)   middle management; and (iii)   the rest of the employees;
(b)    how much money, on monthly basis, the ZRA receives from the Government as grants; and
(c)    whether the grant is given as a percentage of the revenue collected.
(a)    how many commercial livestock farmers there were in Zambia as of 30th May, 2012, province by province; and
(b)    what the total cattle population was as of June, 2012, province by province.
(a)    how much maize, in tonnes, was destroyed by the Food Reserve Agency at the Matipa Satellite Depot in Chilubi District in July, 2012;
(b)    from which satellite depots the maize at (a) was collected; and
(c)    when the Ministry will establish additional satellite depots in Chilubi District. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Supply - Motion (12th October) - Resumption of Debate;  - (Mr Mtolo).
